title: Trump unveils 'Board of Peace' and 'New Gaza' plans at Davos
subhead: Donald Trump also said Thursday he was hopeful of a deal soon to end Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky told the World Economic Forum that documents being drafted with Washington to end the war were 'nearly, nearly ready.'

title: 'Europeans were right to stand firm' against Trump, says France's top business representative
French parties briefly rally around Macron after Trump's attacks
Le Pen concedes little and insists on 'good faith' at appeal trial
subhead: During her second day of questioning in court, far-right leader Marine Le Pen cautiously said she was 'willing to acknowledge' that an offense may have been committed.

title: Two reports accuse Israel of deliberately destroying Gaza's reproductive health system
subhead: The number of births in Gaza fell by 41% in the first six months of 2025 compared to the same period in 2022, according to the work of two NGOs, Physicians for Human Rights and Physicians for Human Rights Israel.

title: Cohere's Joëlle Pineau: 'We aim for AI that creates value for businesses, not superintelligence'
subhead: The former number two in artificial intelligence research at Meta left Mark Zuckerberg's group to join the Canadian start-up.

title: Who are Greenlanders and what do they really want?
subhead: Greenland, which is bigger than France, the UK, Germany and Spain combined, has a population of 57,000, most of whom are Inuit. They are also Danish citizens, a legacy of Denmark's colonization of the territory that began in the 18th century.
byline: Arthur Navet ,  Constance Derouin and  Sinead McCausland

Israeli strike kills three journalists in Gaza, including an AFP freelancer
'As it ceases to inspire, the US is losing part of itself'
subhead: Donald Trump's second term has turned the United States into a threat to which the rest of the world has no choice but to adapt. Yet, over the past eight decades, habits and practices have taken root that will be used to counter this new imperialism, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: In the Ukrainian Carpathians, peace feels both near and far
subhead: In Uzhhorod, a border city near Slovakia, exhausted and disillusioned residents have long stopped believing in victory and expect little from ongoing diplomatic talks. They only hope that the war will end, even 'if it means sacrificing a piece of the country to be saved.'

title: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
subhead: Since returning to the White House, the American president has exempted himself from all rules, both domestically and internationally. This sense of impunity now permeates his entire administration.

title: A brief respite in the transatlantic crisis
'French military involvement in Greenland is not for show'
Golshifteh Farahani, Iranian actress: 'Resisting horror, dictatorships and invaders is in our blood'
